replyContent:
I am sorry that you've encountered issues with Half-Life 2. I would suggest clearing your Google Play Store cache and data. To do so:
Go to Settings - Apps - Google Play Store
Select Storage
Select Clear Cache and Clear Data
Try re-downloading the game
If this does not resolve your issue, please contact us at nvhelp@nvidia.com.

Over all it is a very addicting and fun game to play

It was really unexpected to see Half Life 2 appear at the same time as portal , Thank you Nvidia and Valve for bringing both game to Shield. Edit: I just went through the whole game, no crashes, major lags, the game is perfect!

The cons:  The vehicle control is pretty clumsy compared to modern games and I can see why this aspect of FPSs has developed. The movement mechanics is also frustrating when you're trying to do platform based actions/puzzles as it's really difficult to jump accurately. Climbing and getting off ladders is also annoying. It can also be difficult to know where to go at times. A waypoint compass would make it more fluid to play.  The pros:  Incredible enemy AI. There's none of the nonsense we get now-a-days where you grind down an enemy, hide to regenerate health, then go back to finish them off. Try this in HL2 and you'll be dead within seconds. 'Normal' on HL2 is like 'hardcore' or even 'extreme' on some modern day FPSs. If you want a challenge then this is the game for you.  Then there's the gravity gun. This is possibly one of the best creations for any game. What an idea.   Apart from the movement issue I mentioned in cons, the controls are amazingly smooth compared to other Android FPSs. There's no dead region on the analogue sticks at all.   Devs, please include a quick save button in the next update!  In all, this is an amazing port. Get it. Now.

Obviously Half-life's praises don't need to be sung anymore than they already have. The game alone is worthy of 5 stars, but this port suffers from frequent performance drops especially in open areas or complex environments (multiple light sources, etc.) and these drops are pretty hefty. Dropping well below 30 FPS each time. I imagine that we'll see a optimization update in the future, but until then, you may want to hold off on this title.

I tried moving to SD card as soon installed, after playing for a few minutes and clearing the game data, and then after playing for a few minutes and without clearing. It just doesn't even launch after.
replyContent: Hi Naubahar, glad you are enjoying the game!  Please update your SHIELD to software update 77, which was released on 5/5/14.  The update fixes the ability to move app files to SD card.  For both Portal and Half-Life 2, you are able to move your app files to SD card by going to Settings...Apps...(select HL2 app)...Move to SD card.

It's an unlocked framerate, and it's at 60fps a decent amount of the time, but anytime you get to a spot with a lot of geometry, it drops quite a bit. That being said, it's still VERY playable.
